```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

### Load tidymodels packages

```{r library, results='hide', message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(rsample)
library(recipes)
library(parsnip)
library(yardstick)
library(naniar)
library(finalfit)
```

The data is from kaggle ('german credit risk')
It contains 10 variables, where 
```{r import}
risk <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fabienmata/tidymodels/master/data/german_credit_data.csv", row.names = 'X')
risk %>% head()
```



which variable has missing values


```{r naniar}
risk %>% gg_miss_var()
```

see clearly the missing data points
```{r finalfit}
risk %>% missing_plot()
```


```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
